conceptual.title: Conceptual Dimension
conceptual.definition: Zero-Drift Fidelity (ZDF) refers to the disciplined alignment of every protocol artifact with its originating intent. It treats variance as a systemic contaminant and applies proactive countermeasures to maintain identity across artifacts, agents, and timelines.

principles.name: Intent Anchoring
principles.description: Establish immutable origin statements for each protocol object and route all derivative work through verifiable lineage checks.

principles.name: Contextual Coherence
principles.description: Maintain semantic continuity by cross-referencing adjacent capsules, manifests, and operational logs.

principles.name: Signal Integrity
principles.description: Apply redundancy in sensing, logging, and verification channels so that every state change is corroborated through at least two independent inputs.

principles.name: Adaptive Containment
principles.description: Trigger bounded sandbox branches that absorb drift without polluting production state.

structural_controls.name: Protocol Steward Ledger
structural_controls.description: Immutable append-only journal that captures every stewardship intervention.

structural_controls.name: Fidelity Orbits
structural_controls.description: Nested review cycles (core, supporting, peripheral) that run staggered validations.

structural_controls.name: Integrity Contracts
structural_controls.description: Formal commitments between core avatars and dependent services defining tolerances.

epochs.name: Genesis Epoch
epochs.description: Baseline capture of canonical states, schemas, and avatar roles.

epochs.name: Operational Epochs
epochs.description: Recurring cycles (e.g., 72-hour cadence) wherein all capsule deltas are reconciled against Genesis baselines.

epochs.name: Adaptive Epochs
epochs.description: Triggered by anomalies, these epochs compress validation windows and prioritize drift triage tasks.

kinematic.title: Kinematic Dimension
kinematic.definition: ZDF kinematics focus on the motion of information, authority, and resources across the protocol mesh.

stabilizers.name: Tri-Lock Channels
stabilizers.description: Triple-redundant communication paths needing consensus before high-impact actions.

stabilizers.name: Dynamic Drag Coefficients
stabilizers.description: Adjustable throttles applied to workflows exhibiting high-variance velocity.

stabilizers.name: Feedback Gyros
stabilizers.description: Continuous monitoring loops that compare expected vs. actual state changes.

roles.name: Navigator Avatar
roles.impact: Gains enhanced situational awareness through Fidelity Orbits.

roles.name: Sentinel Avatar
roles.impact: Utilizes Temporal Drift Sentinel data streams to preempt deviations.

roles.name: Artisan Avatar
roles.impact: Benefits from Intent Anchoring and Integrity Contracts.

roles.name: Archivist Avatar
roles.impact: Operates the Protocol Steward Ledger for historical reconstruction.
